description: T1-Laburnum - Several of the trunks previously removed, remaining trunks in poor condition with pronounced lean over the public footpathSuggested works are to fell all trunks to ground levelT2-Bay - Large mature tree not maintained in many years, encroaching on the rear elevation of no 156 and the neighbouring propertySuggested works are to reduce height from 12m to 9m and lateral crown spread from 10m to 6m. This will create a neater, more manageable shape going forwardT3-Eucalyptus - Very large tree previously heavily reduced on the Northern neighbouring side, no 158.This has left an unbalanced crown with several extremely long and overweight lateral limbs.Suggested works are to selectively reduce upper canopy from 15m height to 13m height, leaving a natural rounded appearance.Selectively reduce all overlong and overweight lateral limbs over no 156. Taking the lateral spread from 6m to 3m Hard to give exact measurements as each limb is different length
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
